  • Constructor Details

    • Rabbit

      public Rabbit(boolean grownup)

    • Rabbit

      public Rabbit()
      Initializes variables. - network = a new TunnelNetwork instance. - view_distance = 8 - hunger = 0 - energy = 10 - age = 0 - cooldown = 0 - health_points = 6

  • Method Details

    • act

      public void act(World world)
      Description copied from interface: Actor
      The method called whenever the actor needs to simulate actions. The worlds 'current location' is only set at the time when the method is called. Thus, if you use setTile, remove, or delete, the current position does not automatically update. This has multiple implications, e.g., if you want to use World.getSurroundingTiles() after using World.setTile(itumulator.world.Location, java.lang.Object) within the act method, the program will throw an exception. This can be circumvented by updating the current location (World.setCurrentLocation(itumulator.world.Location)) or exclusively using the World methods which accepts a location parameter (by the same name).
      Parameters:
      world - providing details of the position on which the actor is currently located and much more.

    • getInformation

      public DisplayInformation getInformation()
      Description copied from interface: DynamicDisplayInformationProvider
      Should provide DisplayInformation to determine the visualization of the object.
      Returns:
      DisplayInformation.

    • canDig

      protected boolean canDig(World world, Location location)
      Checks if the tile at the given Location in world either has no nonblocking, contains an instance of a Plant or contains an instance of a Burrow.
      Parameters:
      world - World that the tile is in.
      location - Location to check for 'digability'.
      Returns:
      If it is possible to dig at Location parameter in the World parameter.

    • digHole

      public void digHole(World world, Location location)
      Instantiates a Burrow and places it in world at location if possible. If there is already a Burrow at the location in the world, then the Burrow is added to this Rabbits TunnelNetwork.
      Parameters:
      world - World to dig in
      location - Location in world to dig at

    • burrowSelf

      public void burrowSelf(World world)
      If this is on a Burrow, then enter(remove from world parameters tiles). Else take a step toward the nearest Burrow in the TunnelNetwork burrows on this.
      Parameters:
      world - World that this is in

    • unburrow

      public void unburrow(World world)
      Places this back in world on one of the Burrows in the TunnelNetwork this Rabbit has. If no Burrow is available to leave from then a new hole is dug and unburrow is called again.
      Parameters:
      world - World this will be placed in

    • getClosestHole

      protected Burrow getClosestHole(Location location, World world)
      If this Rabbits TunnelNetwork is empty then digHole(...) is called and the method stops.
      Parameters:
      location - Location to search from
      world - World to search in
      Returns:
      The closest Burrow in this Rabbit's TunnelNetwork to location in world.

    • restoreEnergy

      protected void restoreEnergy()

    • getGrownup

      public boolean getGrownup()
      Specified by:
      getGrownup in class Animal
      Returns:
      Whether this is grown up, defined by if age is larger than or equal to 3.

    • getAge

      public double getAge()
      Returns:
      Value of age field inherited from Animal.

    • getNetwork

      public TunnelNetwork getNetwork()
      Returns:
      Reference to this Rabbit's TunnelNetwork, stored in the network field.

    • getFoodValue

      public double getFoodValue()
      Description copied from interface: Edible
      Method signature intended for implementation by anything Edible. Its purpose is to return that things food value, that is how much you get from eating it.
      Returns:
      Food value of Rabbit, which is 5.

    • getEdibleClasses

      public List<Class<?>> getEdibleClasses()
      Description copied from class: Animal
      Used by eat to make sure instances of Animal-subclasses only eat what they should.
      Overrides:
      getEdibleClasses in class Animal
      Returns:
      A List of edible classes. For Rabbits, it only contains Grass.
